dawn.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: the time at the beginning of the day when light first appears
dawn.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: When dawn broke  (=the first light of the day appeared), we were still 50 miles from Calcutta.
I was up at the crack of dawn  (=very early in the morning) to get the plane.
We worked from dawn to dusk  (=through the whole day while it is light).
The boats set off at dawn.
dawn.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: if day or morning dawns, it begins
dawn.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: The morning dawned fresh and clear after the storm.
dawn.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: if a period of time or situation dawns, it begins
dawn.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: The age of Darwin had dawned.
dawn.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: if a feeling or idea dawns, you have it for the first time
dawn.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: It began to dawn that something was wrong.
